result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CM868 and Case #15CM1400.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person at 12-08-2015 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 12-03-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests a jury status and jury trial date on this case.  Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests an adjourned date so he can get an offer on all of defendant's cases and he can obtain discovery from the public defender's office. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Signed by Judge Carter on 06/19/15. Atty Thomas Voss has been appointed. Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing on 08/03/15.
Hearing on July 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers moves to withdraw as counsel due to Defendant not qualifying for public defender representation any more.  Court grants request.  Defendant states he will be requesting a court appointed attorney. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.
Dated 06/15/15, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, giving notice that the Defendant is no ineligible for PD representation.
Hearing on June 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Weathers requests an adjournment as she was just assigned this case. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant state he wishes to see public defender.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
